verses.kjv: For I would that ye knew what great conflict I have for you, and for them at Laodicea, and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh;
verses.ct: I want you to know how intensely I'm struggling for you, for the believers in Laodicea, and for everyone who hasn't met me personally.

verses.kjv: That their hearts might be comforted, being knit together in love, and unto all riches of the full assurance of understanding, to the acknowledgement of the mystery of God, and of the Father, and of Christ;
verses.ct: My goal is that their hearts would be encouraged, united together in love, and that they would experience the complete richness of confident understanding — fully knowing the mystery of God, that is, Christ himself.

verses.kjv: In whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
verses.ct: In him, all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge are hidden.

verses.kjv: And this I say, lest any man should beguile you with enticing words.
verses.ct: I'm telling you this so that no one will deceive you with persuasive-sounding arguments.

verses.kjv: For though I be absent in the flesh, yet am I with you in the spirit, joying and beholding your order, and the stedfastness of your faith in Christ.
verses.ct: Even though I'm not physically present with you, I am with you in spirit, and I'm glad to see your good discipline and the firmness of your faith in Christ.

verses.kjv: As ye have therefore received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk ye in him:
verses.ct: So since you accepted Christ Jesus as Lord, continue living your lives in him.

verses.kjv: Rooted and built up in him, and stablished in the faith, as ye have been taught, abounding therein with thanksgiving.
verses.ct: Stay rooted and built up in him, strengthened in the faith just as you were taught, overflowing with gratitude.

verses.kjv: Beware lest any man spoil you through philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men, after the rudiments of the world, and not after Christ.
verses.ct: Watch out that no one takes you captive through hollow philosophy and empty deception, based on human traditions and the basic principles of this world rather than on Christ.

verses.kjv: For in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead bodily.
verses.ct: Because the entire fullness of God's nature lives in Christ in bodily form.

verses.kjv: And ye are complete in him, which is the head of all principality and power:
verses.ct: And you have been made complete in him, who is the head over every ruler and authority.

verses.kjv: In whom also ye are circumcised with the circumcision made without hands, in putting off the body of the sins of the flesh by the circumcision of Christ:
verses.ct: In him you also received a circumcision not performed by human hands — the removal of your sinful nature through the circumcision that belongs to Christ.

verses.kjv: Buried with him in baptism, wherein also ye are risen with him through the faith of the operation of God, who hath raised him from the dead.
verses.ct: You were buried with him in baptism, and in that same baptism you were also raised with him through your faith in the power of God, who raised him from the dead.

verses.kjv: And you, being dead in your sins and the uncircumcision of your flesh, hath he quickened together with him, having forgiven you all trespasses;
verses.ct: You were dead because of your sins and your uncircumcised nature, but God made you alive together with Christ, forgiving every one of your sins.

verses.kjv: Blotting out the handwriting of ordinances that was against us, which was contrary to us, and took it out of the way, nailing it to his cross;
verses.ct: He erased the record of charges that stood against us with its legal demands, removing it completely by nailing it to the cross.

verses.kjv: And having spoiled principalities and powers, he made a shew of them openly, triumphing over them in it.
verses.ct: He stripped the rulers and authorities of their power, publicly humiliating them and triumphing over them through the cross.

verses.kjv: Let no man therefore judge you in meat, or in drink, or in respect of an holyday, or of the new moon, or of the sabbath days:
verses.ct: So don't let anyone pass judgment on you about what you eat or drink, or about observing festivals, new moon celebrations, or Sabbath days.

verses.kjv: Which are a shadow of things to come; but the body is of Christ.
verses.ct: These things are only a shadow of what was coming — the reality itself belongs to Christ.

verses.kjv: Let no man beguile you of your reward in a voluntary humility and worshipping of angels, intruding into those things which he hath not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,
verses.ct: Don't let anyone disqualify you from your prize by insisting on false humility and the worship of angels, going on about visions they claim to have had, inflated with pride by their unspiritual thinking.

verses.kjv: And not holding the Head, from which all the body by joints and bands having nourishment ministered, and knit together, increaseth with the increase of God.
verses.ct: Such a person has lost connection with the Head, from whom the entire body — supported and held together by its joints and ligaments — grows with the growth that comes from God.

verses.kjv: Wherefore if ye be dead with Christ from the rudiments of the world, why, as though living in the world, are ye subject to ordinances,
verses.ct: If you died with Christ to the basic principles of this world, then why do you live as though you still belong to it by submitting to its rules —

verses.kjv: (Touch not; taste not; handle not;
verses.ct: "Don't touch this! Don't taste that! Don't even pick it up!"

verses.kjv: Which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?
verses.ct: All these things are destined to disappear as they're used up. They are based on nothing more than human commands and teachings.

verses.kjv: Which things have indeed a shew of wisdom in will worship, and humility, and neglecting of the body; not in any honour to the satisfying of the flesh.
verses.ct: These rules may appear wise with their self-imposed worship, false humility, and harsh treatment of the body, but they have no real value in controlling sinful desires.
